intro: Paraderris lianoides, commonly known as the coastal honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Australia. It is a trailing or climbing shrub that typically grows along sandy soils and rocky outcrops. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink, which bloom in spring. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. It is well adapted to salt-laden winds and can tolerate periods of drought.
